wikipedia_page.main: Ralph W. Brinton (1895–1975) was a British art director. He was nominated for an Academy Award in the category Best Art Direction for the film Tom Jones.

link_mentions.page: Academy Award for Best Production Design
response: | Ralph W. Brinton, Jocelyn Herbert, and Ted Marshall
| Ralph W. Brinton, Ted Marshall, Jocelyn Herbert and Josie MacAvin
**Tom Jones – Art Direction: Ralph W. Brinton, Ted Marshall, and Jocelyn Herbert; Set Decoration: Josie MacAvin

De Carlo arrived in London in December 1950 and filming started in January 1951. It was shot at Pinewood Studios with sets designed by the art director Ralph W. Brinton. There was also some location filming in Egypt. She later said "the production couldn't have run more smoothly and Peter was a delight to work with."De Carlo p 154 During filming, Ustinov met Suzanne Cloutier who became his wife.
The sets were designed by the art director Ralph W. Brinton. Established actresses Greta Gynt and Margot Grahame and future Irish star Constance Smith all make brief appearances.
The film's sets were designed by the art director Ralph W. Brinton.

It was made at Wembley Studios by the British subsidiary of the Fox Film Company.http://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b6ae97245 The film's sets were designed by the art director Ralph W. Brinton.

response: | Nominated in the Color category.  Shared with Jocelyn Herbert (set decorator); Ralph W. Brinton and Ted Marshall (art directors).
